question: Can a character with Darkvision roll perception without disadvantage?
rules: Adventuring > Vision and Light >  Darkvision > "Within a specified range, a creature with darkvision can see in darkness as if the darkness were dim light, so areas of darkness are only lightly obscured as far as that creature is concerned."

Adventuring > Vision and Light > Vision and Light > "In a lightly obscured area, such as dim light, patchy fog, or moderate foliage, creatures have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight."
rules_explanation: In areas of dim light (which is how darkness appears to a creature with darkvision), creatures without darkvision have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. A creature with darkvision can see in dim light as if it were bright light, so they would not have disadvantage.

question: If a Halfling and a Medium character are swimming in a river of rushing water, what kind of check do they make to determine if they can grab onto the side?
rules: Adventuring > Movement > Special Types of Movement > Climbing, Swimming, and Crawling > "Similarly, gaining any distance in rough water might require a successful Strength (Athletics) check."
rules_explanation: There are two ways to interpret the question. As a default check it should be a Strength saving throw as the characters are being acted upon by an outside force (the water). However because they want to grab something it would change to a Strength Check as this is the only time they have control over their actions.

question: Can the cleric use a 4th level spell to restore one point of exhaustion on a long rested team member?

question: If someone has the keen sight trait, do they still roll with disadvantage in dim light when attempting to perceive something?
rules: Adventuring > Vision and Light >  Lightly Obscured > "In a lightly obscured area, such as dim light, patchy fog, or moderate foliage, creatures have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight."
rules_explanation: Keen Sight provides advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. Advantage and disadvantage cancel each other out, so if a roll has both advantage and disadvantage, you roll one d20.
